title: A Complete List of Books Chosen for Oprah's...
text:
By Erin Collazo Miller Updated September 26, 2016 . 
Since its inception, Oprah's Book Club has been a cultural force that has pushed many books that would otherwise have been overlooked by the general public onto the bestseller lists. The so-called "Oprah Effect" is estimated to have sold nearly 60 million copies of its selections, and has made several authors into household names simply by their selection. Oprah's Book Club has been credited with reviving a culture of literary discussion to a large extent, and represents one of the most lasting legacies of the original Oprah Winfrey Show. 
The 75 novels so far chosen for the Club are listed here by year of selection. Oprah's Book Club 2.0 is based on Winfrey's OWN network. 
1996: The Book of Ruth by Jane Hamilton Song of Solomon by Toni Morrison The Deep End of the Ocean by by Jacquelyn Mitchard 
1997: The Meanest Thing to Say by Bill Cosby The Treasure Hunt by Bill Cosby The Best Way to Play by Bill Cosby Ellen Foster by Kaye Gibbons A Virtuous Woman by Kaye Gibbons
